head.title: Red Sox Lose Starters Lowell and Drew to Injuries

hedline.hl1: Red Sox Lose Starters Lowell and Drew to Injuries
hedline.hl2: Red Sox Lose Starters Lowell and Drew to Injuries

block.p: While losing to the Yankees, 9-5, on Friday night, the Red Sox also lost two starters to injuries, at least temporarily.

Third baseman Mike Lowell, hit by a 93-mile-an-hour fastball from Chien-Ming Wang in the third inning, left in the top of the fifth with a bruised left hand. X-rays did not show a break, the Red Sox announced. Right fielder J. D. Drew left in the top of the sixth with a strained right hamstring.

While losing to the Yankees, 9-5, on Friday night, the Red Sox also lost two starters to injuries, at least temporarily.

Third baseman Mike Lowell, hit by a 93-mile-an-hour fastball from Chien-Ming Wang in the third inning, left in the top of the fifth with a bruised left hand. X-rays did not show a break, the Red Sox announced. Right fielder J. D. Drew left in the top of the sixth with a strained right hamstring.

Lowell is batting .328 with 10 home runs and 41 runs batted in. Drew is hitting .222 with 2 home runs and 17 R.B.I., although Manager Terry Francona expressed optimism before the game that Drew's slump would soon end.
''He's going to be O.K.,'' Francona said. ''He's too good a hitter. Sometimes you have to be patient and tell him you believe in him -- which we do.''

Over all, it was not an impressive performance for the Red Sox, who began the night with a 10-game lead in the American League East over second-place Baltimore. They were 13 1/2 games ahead of the Yankees, who were tied for fourth with Tampa Bay.
(The Devil Rays lost Friday to Kansas City.)

Tim Wakefield, the starting pitcher, struggled mightily for Boston. He left after three and two-thirds innings after giving up eight runs and five hits. Wakefield (5-6) is a knuckleball pitcher. He walked five batters, hit one, threw one wild pitch and catcher Doug Mirabelli had one passed ball.
The Yankees scored one run on the wild pitch and one run on the passed ball. Wakefield threw 81 pitches, only 38 of them strikes.

Until Friday night, the most serious injury this season for the Red Sox was to starter Josh Beckett, who sustained a torn flap of skin on his right middle finger in May and spent 15 days on the disabled list. Beckett has since returned and raised his record to 8-0 with a 4-2 victory against Cleveland on Tuesday.
